metadata.title: CVE-2021-3700 on Ubuntu 22.10 (kinetic) - low.
metadata.description:
A use-after-free vulnerability was found in usbredir in versions prior to 0.11.0 in the usbredirparser_serialize() in usbredirparser/usbredirparser.c. This issue occurs when serializing large amounts of buffered write data in the case of a slow or blocked destination.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2021-3700` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

libusbredirhost1 - 0.11.0-1
libusbredirparser1 - 0.11.0-1
usbredirect - 0.11.0-1
usbredirserver - 0.11.0-1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: usbredir package in kinetic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '0.11.0-1').
